Models¶

Base¶

The Base classes help ensure the following:

  1. All maternal models use a UUID as the primary key.
  2. Eligibility models have a foreign key to RegisteredSubject.
  3. Scheduled models have a foreign key to MaternalVisit.
class mpepu_maternal.models.MyBaseUuidModel(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_sync.classes.base_sync_model.BaseSyncModel

Base model for all maternal models

  • registration_datetime (DateTimeField) – Today’s date
  • maternal_consent_id (OneToOneField) – Mother’s consent
  • is_hiv_positive (CharField) – By indicating YES, you confirm that you have copied such evidence for the patient chart
  • agree_follow_up (CharField) – if no ,INELIGIBLE

Consent¶

class mpepu_maternal.models.MaternalConsent(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_botswana.models.base_consent.BaseConsent

Model for maternal consent and registration model for mothers.

Name :

Maternal Consent
Table :

mpepu_maternal_maternalconsent
Parameters:
  • subject_identifier (CharField) – Subject identifier
  • first_name (EncryptedFirstnameField) – (Encryption: local-rsa)
  • last_name (EncryptedLastnameField) – (Encryption: restricted-rsa)
  • initials (CharField) – Initials
  • dob (DateField) – Format is YYYY-MM-DD
  • is_dob_estimated (IsDateEstimatedField) – If the exact date is not known, please indicate which part of the date is estimated.
  • gender (CharField) – Gender
  • subject_type (CharField) – Subject type
  • screening_datetime (DateTimeField) – Screening datetime
  • registration_datetime (DateTimeField) – Registration datetime
  • randomization_datetime (DateTimeField) – Randomization datetime
  • registration_status (CharField) – Registration status
  • study_site_id (ForeignKey) – This refers to the site or ‘clinic area’ where the subject is being consented.
  • consent_datetime (DateTimeField) – Consent date and time
  • guardian_name (EncryptedLastnameField) – Required only if subject is a minor. Format is ‘LASTNAME, FIRSTNAME’. All uppercase separated by a comma (Encryption: restricted-rsa)
  • may_store_samples (CharField) – Does the subject agree to have samples stored after the study has ended
  • comment (EncryptedTextField) – (Encryption: local-aes)
  • identity (EncryptedOmangField) – Use Omang, Passport number, driver’s license number or Omang receipt number (Encryption: restricted-rsa)
  • identity_type (IdentityTypeField) – What type of identity number is this?

Registration¶

Mothers are registered to the study using the MaternalConsent.

Warning

Is this model used?

Enrollment¶

In Mpepu, the Maternal Enrollment form is not a registration form and may be completed at any time between registration and randomization.

class mpepu_maternal.models.MaternalEnroll(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: mpepu_maternal.models.base_scheduled_visit_model.BaseScheduledVisitModel

Model for Maternal enrollment (first of several).

mp003

this is not a registration form, just a form to collect ‘other data’ This form is initiated at the time of maternal enrollment, and can be completed and submitted any time before randomization

Name :

Maternal Enrollment
Table :

mpepu_maternal_maternalenroll
Parameters:
  • maternal_visit_id (ForeignKey) – Maternal visit
  • recruit_source (CharField) –
    1. the mother first learned about the mpepu study from
  • recruit_source_other (OtherCharField) – 1a. if other specify...
  • prev_pregnancies (IntegerField) –
    1. not including this pregnancy, how many previous pregnancies for this participant?
  • prior_health_haart (CharField) – For her own health and not just PMTCT for an earlier pregnancy or breastfeeding.
  • prev_pregnancy_arv (CharField) – not including this pregnancy
  • weight (DecimalField) – Measured in Kilograms (kg)
  • height (DecimalField) – Measured in Centimeters (cm)

class mpepu_maternal.models.maternal_arv_post.MaternalArvPostAdh(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mpepu_maternal.models.base_scheduled_visit_model.BaseScheduledVisitModel

Maternal ARV adherence post-partum.

complete if YES for haart_last_visit in MaternalArvPost

Name :

Maternal ARVs Post: Adherence
Table :

mpepu_maternal_maternalarvpostadh
Parameters:
  • maternal_visit_id (ForeignKey) – Maternal visit
  • maternal_arv_post_id (OneToOneField) – Maternal arv post
  • missed_doses (IntegerField) –
    1. since the last attended last scheduled visit, how many doses of haart were missed?
  • missed_days (IntegerField) –
    1. since the last attended scheduled visit, how many entire days was haart not taken?
  • missed_days_discnt (IntegerField) –
    1. if haart discontinued by health provider, how many days was haart missed prior to haart discontinuation?
  • comment (TextField) –
    1. comment

Labor and Delivery¶

The Labor and Delivery model is responsible to create as many infant identifiers as indicated by the field attribute live_infants_to_register.

class mpepu_maternal.models.maternal_lab_del.MaternalLabDel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mpepu_maternal.models.base_scheduled_visit_model.BaseScheduledVisitModel

Maternal Labor and Delivery which triggers registration of infants.

Name :

Maternal Labour & Delivery
Table :

mpepu_maternal_maternallabdel
Parameters:
  • maternal_visit_id (ForeignKey) – Maternal visit
  • delivery_datetime (DateTimeField) – If TIME unknown, estimate
  • del_time_is_est (CharField) – 1a. is the delivery time estimated?
  • labour_hrs (CharField) – For multiple births, time of delivery = time first infant born
  • del_mode (CharField) –
    1. mode of delivery
  • has_ga (CharField) – If known, complete below
  • ga (IntegerField) – in weeks
  • del_hosp (CharField) – If ‘Other health facility’ or ‘Other’, specify below
  • del_hosp_other (OtherCharField) – ...if “other”, specify
  • has_urine_tender (CharField) –
    1. was uterine tenderness recorded?
  • labr_max_temp (DecimalField) – In degrees Celcius. -1 = unknown
  • has_chorioamnionitis (CharField) –
    1. was chorio-amnionitis suspected?
  • has_del_comp (CharField) – ( if ‘YES’ continue. Otherwise go to question 10 )
  • del_comp_other (TextField) – 9a. if other, describe the complication
  • live_infants (IntegerField) –
    1. how many live babies did the mother deliver?
  • live_infants_to_register (IntegerField) – 10a. how many babies are registering to the study?
  • still_borns (IntegerField) – ( if ‘>0’ continue. Otherwise go to question 13 )
  • still_born_has_congen_abn (CharField) –
    1. if any stillborns, did any have a congenital abnormality noted?
  • still_born_congen_abn (OtherCharField) – 12a. if yes, specify;
  • del_comment (TextField) –
    1. list any addtional information about the labour and delivery (mother only)
  • comment (TextField) – Comment if any additional pertinent information

Post Partum¶

class mpepu_maternal.models.maternal_post_fu.MaternalPostFu(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mpepu_maternal.models.base_scheduled_visit_model.BaseScheduledVisitModel

General post-partum follow-up.

Name :

Maternal Postnatal Follow-Up
Table :

mpepu_maternal_maternalpostfu
Parameters:
  • maternal_visit_id (ForeignKey) – Maternal visit
  • mother_weight (CharField) – (If Yes,complete 2a.If No,go to question 3)
  • enter_weight (DecimalField) – kg
  • breastfeeding (CharField) – (If no,skip to question 4)
  • had_mastitis (CharField) – 2a. if yes,since the last attended scheduled visit,has the mother had mastitis at any time?
  • has_chronic_cond (CharField) – 4.since the last attended scheduled visit, has the mother had any of the following chronic health conditions, which were new diagnoses (never previously reported)?
  • chronic_cond_other (OtherCharField) – ...if “other”, specify
  • started_ctx (CharField) – 7.since the last attended scheduled visit, has the mother started ctx?
  • comment (CharField) – 8.comment if any additional pertinent information:
class mpepu_maternal.models.maternal_post_fu.MaternalPostFuDx(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mpepu_maternal.models.base_scheduled_visit_model.BaseScheduledVisitModel

Post-partum follow up of diagnosis.

Name :

Maternal Postnatal Follow-Up: Dx
Table :

mpepu_maternal_maternalpostfudx
Parameters:
  • maternal_visit_id (ForeignKey) – Maternal visit
  • maternal_post_fu_id (OneToOneField) – Maternal post fu
  • mother_hospitalized (CharField) – if yes, the primary diagnosis associated with the hospitalization(s) must be recorded in Postnatal diagnosis section
  • new_diagnoses (CharField) – if yes, tick all that apply, only report grade 3 0r 4 diagnoses
  • who_clinical_stage (CharField) – never previously reported, or a NEW episode of a previously resolved diagnosis, and which is NOT reported above in Question 6
